reviews.title: Not a "Spa" at all. More like a decorated Best Western
reviews.text: Driving from New Mexico to California we stopped here. We arrived at 12:30 a.m. -- and stayed only after the gentleman at the registration desk assured us we could have a late check-out. The room -- it was called a "suite" but was more a large room with 2 television sets -- was nicely decorated but a bit cramped -- though it had two spectacularly large bathrooms (without tubs, only showers, very PC). The lighting was inadequate and made use of the ugly new fluorescent bulbs, and though it was well below freezing, we were tempted to leave the heat off because the room is heated only through a very noisy space heater mounted on the wall and belching dusty air across the room. And needless to say, the hotel absolutely refused to honor the late check out promise -- even to the extent of another 15 minutes. The food was mediocre and the service surly. But the tile work in the courtyard was beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sedona Rouge is a beautiful, peaceful hotel. It is beautifully decorated, very clean and their customer service is outstanding! Everyone we met was so nice and willing to help, from the desk staff, conceirge, housekeeping, and wait staff at Reds. The courtyard entrance is so peaceful with several waterfalls and the room was very nice, with soft down comforters and linens! Loved the bath soaps and rainfall shower head!! I really like the open air concept of the hotel...they have a fire pit on the 3rd level and the star gazing is gorgeous! They have a restaurant on site...Reds and it is amazing! Had several meals there they all were so good - from breakfast to dinner!!! The hotel is located by a shopping area, but it turned out to be a good thing.....the noise is not a factor and we needed to walk over for a few items!! Just being in Sedona is a gift, but where you stay matters and if you choose the Sedona Rouge you wont be disappointed!! (and the hotel rates are great!!)
reviews.title: A little oasis in Sedona!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved my stay at Sedona Rouge! It's at a great location (right on the highway). Check-in was very fast, friendly staff, gorgeous courtyard with the fountain. My enjoyed the interior of the room, it was very up to date and clean with a modern application. I loved the shower haha, one over top head and one side head with a glass wall, very classy =].
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay at Sedona Rouge Hotel. I enjoyed the contemporary design of the immaculate rooms. The meals I had in the hotel were great for breakfast and dinner. I would be happy to return to this hotel again if I were in Sedona. I didn't like the very small gym much but I was able to find a nice one close by. However the gym does have a nice view of the pool and mountain.
reviews.title: Beautiful upscale hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: To start with, the scenery in Sedona is spectacular and to go there is a gift to yourself. We have stayed at the Sedona Rouge twice and had wonderful experiences both times. The spa is small and expensive, but the therapists are the best and so is the steam room. The restaurant, Reds, has attentive service and excellent french toast, with several nice dinner specials. I found all of the employees to be helpful.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at Sedona Rouge for one evening on a girls getaway to Arizona. What a wonderful experience! I will always book with Sedona Rouge when I stay in Sedona. The beds are so comfortable and the showers are too cool. We had snacks at Reds (the restaurant) and Liliana was a wonderful server. The hot tub was nice and toasty and the pool heated. The only complaint I have is that the fireplaces were not lit and therefore we could not enjoy the rooftop terrace. It was nice to be slightly off the main drag and yet close to stores and such. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I highly recommend the Sedona Rouge!
reviews.title: Awesome experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here the nights of April 29 & 30, 2011. Our first room had a bathtub within what should have been a shower stall. Due to a cancellation, another room was available for $20 additional. That room had a big shower and fireplace, so we took the "better" room. But there would be another price to pay. Yes, the hotel is off of a main road. With the A/C running--low sound--it blocks any road noise. This is Sedona and it is what it is. The main Hotels are on the main road. Unless you stay in a high end hotel--we have--the cost might not be worth it. Unknown to us, there was a Wedding party staying in that section of the hotel and they let it be know that they were drunk after the reception on 4/30. In the middle of the night they were yelling and slamming doors. The Hotel did have a "night manager" who stayed away. I had two options: 1. Do nothing or #2 open the door and be told to go F myself. That would have resulted in the Police coming to restore order. If you ever wondered how a wedding party could end up in jail, we experience the how and why. They were too loud and NASCARish. Was this the Hotel's fault, no but the night manger should have heard the issue and took action to quiet things down. The next time this happens, I'll just call the Police to restore order. Would we stay here again–yes buy we would check for any wedding parties staying here.
reviews.title: Thanks to the Wedding Party for Waking Us Up!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Whenever I am in Sedona I stay here. I find it to be a very restful and enjoyable place with big comfortable well appointed rooms with excellent beds and great bathrooms. Yes, it is on a busy stretch of road but the place itself is very tranquil. It sits on quite a bit of leafy property and has many interesting water features. I disagree with the characterization of the hotel as a refurbed motel. I am pretty sure it was built new after a restaurant was knocked down. It seems like the idea is for the common areas to be outdoor courtyards and atriums instead of indoor spaces and hallways. There's also a great observation deck on the top of the hotel. I think it's a really great place to enjoy Sedona.
reviews.title: I stay here all the time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We purchased a great package deal through Travelzoo.com which included two nights, two breakfast vouchers, and two credits in their spa which allowed us a couple's massage. It was our 10 year wedding anniversary, so this was a beautiful way to celebreate!
reviews.title: Lovely, tranquil, and peaceful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location was ideal, as it was a comfortable walking distance to restaurants and the grocery store to get snacks and water for in the room. The resort itself was VERY quiet and peaceful, and even though it's right along a busy street, I never once heard any traffic noise.
reviews.title: Beautiful, zen setting and a wonderful staff and restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me just say, that I would definitely stay here again. The hotel is very beautiful, rooms are clean and I love the decor. I also recommend eating at REDS, each morning we had fantastic breakfast. The only issue I had is that I first booked a Deluxe room and upgraded to Premier and to tell you the truth there is no real big difference. So if you are not sure about choosing between Premier and Deluxe, save your few dollars on the upgrade.
reviews.title: No need to upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were moving from Texas to Arizona and decided to drive since we wanted to see Santa Fe and Sedona. We chose Sedona Rouge because of the great presentation on the web site AND because they accepted dogs. Arrived late (about 9:30) and asked where we could grab dinner - were told that Reds, the in-house restaurant, was still serving. So we dropped our bags in the room and walked over, only to be told that it was closed. A bit of a surprise that the front desk staff didn't know the restaurant hours. We loved our room - spacious and comfy - great shower & tub and the bed was awesome. Had room service for breakfast both mornings which was served promptly and hot. My wife enjoyed a one-hour massage in the spa - said it was one of the better massages she's had. We got good lunch and dinner suggestions from the concierge and really liked the proximity of the hotel to the rest of town. We'll be back for sure!
reviews.title: Two days of bliss at the end of a long trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Room,staff,concierge,everyone was a 10. I wouldn't ever think of staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Everything was marvelous, the hotel is very pretty, the room design and decoration is very beautiful. The beding is so comfortable we had a harsbtime getting out of bed. Staff is friendly and helpful, we will definitely come back to Sedona Rouge several times.
reviews.title: Outstanding... Could not have been better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we love the location of this hotel. Right in the middle of town/close to restaurants (although the one on property is excellent), grocery, hiking, movies, etc. A short drive to gorgeous golf. Views are spectacular, staff very friendly and helpful. Our room is all it needs to be - comfortable bed/well appointed bath/new tv. Will definitely return and recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Terrific vacation in Sedona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I met some friends at Sedona Rouge and it was a perfect arrangement. The rooms are very large, including the plush bathrooms. After going separate ways during the day, we met up in the afternoon and evenings around the fire ring on the rooftop viewing area. It was perfect. The people were nice and the beds were heaven! I love the pillows. I would stay here again in a minute if I return to Sedona. It's a few yards away from the Coffee Pot restaurant which offers wonderful breakfasts!
reviews.title: Peaceful and luxurious hotel, great with friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Sedona Rouge in March 2011 and enjoyed it very much! Our room was a corner room on the 2nd floor with a view of the Zen garden and a sculpture garden in the back of the hotel. The bed was Very comfortable and the hotel was quiet. We were there with another couple and our rooms were next to each other. My husband and I both used the fitness center ~ which is a real fitness center with glass windows looking out to the pool and whirlpool. We did not use the pool as it was a little cool but there were plenty of guests who were out using the pool. We found the location convenient and easy to find. There is also a grocery store right next door which was also convenient. We got a good rate on a room here through a travel website. We also ate breakfast in Reds twice and a late night light meal with drinks one night. I would stay here again if I was ever in Sedona.
reviews.title: Loved this place ~ would stay here again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Sedona Rouge Hotel because of the great deal that was offered. Stay 2 nights and get the 3rd free with a $50 hotel credit thrown in. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious, the grounds and facilities were well kept and the staff was friendly and helpful. They could have had the ice machines turned on since the temps were in the 70's but you could get ice from the bar. The location is convenient with a variety of restaurants and coffee shops (try Java Love across the street) and a Safeway next door. Being a micro brew aficionado, the Oak Creek brewery is a short walk away.
reviews.title: Spectacular views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel has a great location with convenient shopping & being very near Downtown Sedona. We liked the clean white cotton bed linens, the great shower, the lovely view from our patio area & the efficient layout of the room with a small refrigerator. The grounds were meticulous & the hotel's "Red" restaurant had excellent service, reasonably priced breakfast menu options & a wonderful dinner menu. It was also decorated very nicely.
reviews.title: Alovely & comfortable place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our otherwise wonderful trip was ruined by the rude attitude of the Front Desk clerk at check out. But let me start at the beginning. Location is easy to get to and centrally located but, being right off Highway 89A, not very high-end, plush or exotic. Check in was pleasant and efficient. Rooms are clean and nice ...but not resort level. It was apparent the restaurant staff was very well trained and the level of service provided by the restaurant staff was always excellent.
reviews.title: Otherwise wonderful trip ruined by rude Front Desk clerk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently visited Sedona over the Easter weekend. We stayed at the Sedona Rouge Spa Resort in W. Sedona. The staff is friendly and accomodating, our room was beautifully appointed and immaculate. We enjoyed the location of the resort ( a quick 5 minutes west of Sedona village) as it was quiet and close to the red rock views.
reviews.title: Sedona Rouge..Wonderful!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Spa is fantastic-beautiful and the clinicians are very attentive and professional.
reviews.title: We had a nice view of the Safeway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recommend this resort to anyone visiting Sedona.
reviews.title: Sleepless nights at a Spruced up motel practically in a strip mall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ask for Barbara for body work!!! I am a massage therapist and have been trained at one of the best schools in the world yet she is the best therapist I have ever found.. I am also a nurse practitioner and understand the positive benefits of a well trained and intuitive body worker. She is worth her weight in gold!!!! I have never found a massage therapist I would recommend so highly.
reviews.title: Great Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a bit off the main tourist strip, but well worth it! It's very romantic with a courtyard fireplace, outdoor hot tub. The restaurant had good food too. We stayed in the back building where its a bit more secluded. Close to hiking. The bed was SO comfortable, felt like royalty!
reviews.title: Very Nice place, and quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I spent three nights at Sedona Rouge over Spring Break. Upon arrival at the hotel we encountered a slight problem with our reservation, but the manager was helpful and very efficient in correcting the problem. The location of the hotel was perfect, with quick access to restaurants throughout West Sedona and a short drive to the shops uptown. The view from the hotel was gorgeous and the accomodations were very comfortable. The room was of adequate size with a small balcony looking out towards Courthouse Butte. The hotel was very quiet and serene. Our kids (ages 8 and 10) loved the stay!
reviews.title: Sedona Spring Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at this hotel. This was our first time at this hotel, but we have been to Sedona many times before. Room was big, clean and comfortable. We were really surprised at how big their basic room was. Hotel is just outside of town which is what we wanted on this stay. The restaurant was great for breakfast. Maid service was prompt and quick. The property was also very nice, small gym with cardio machines and a nice pool with hot tub. We would stay again.
reviews.title: no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: An interesting note, is that due to rate changes we stayed here for three nights and Amara Resort for three nights. We liked this hotel better. Amara is right in town though so if you like that choose them. We were not thrilled with service at Amara Resort, though all else was very comparable. When in Sedona again we will choose Sedona Rouge.
reviews.title: Wonderful again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: I landed at Rouge after a B&B I had booked for 3 nights turned out to be unacceptable. The town was booked for the weekend but they managed to find me a room each night of my stay. The place is new and lovely with beautiful views of the red rocks. The restaurant excellent with great music. But what I'll remember most is the friendly and helpful staff -- not just at the hotel but also in the restaurant and the spa. I am recommending to all my friends and would definitely stay here again. Thanks Rouge!
reviews.title: loved the place
Loved it!
reviews.text: My husband and spent 3 days in the Sedona Rouge October 17-19.The room was large and very comfortable especially the bed.The large walk in shower with rain head was great after a long day hiking.I love the shampoo and soap so much that I brought some from the spa shop,lemon and mint it smells so nice.Ate at their resturant,Red's several times.Food and service was great.Our room was off the courtyard on second floor and we experienced no excessive noise.We highly recomend eating breakfast at the CoffeePot within walking distance.Great food,hot coffee and the price is right.Would stay there again.
